"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53feac916368721e0c930000#post_53feac916368721e0c930000
[bq="QuasarNova"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53feabb3636872220e1f0100#post_53feabb3636872220e1f0100

You coul pm him and ask.

And you're right, the fact that NASA manges to operate with it's current budget is pretty amazing? You did mentioned the military budget would face a sudden decrease in the next years, maybe some of it can be employed into this area.[/bq]
Doubtful; there's too many people in congress that have watched Armageddon thinking it's scientifically accurate and have the mentality of "yeehaw cowboys!  Them rocks from space might damage muh freedums?  We'll nuke it and shows thems commie rocks from space not to mess around wit muh lands of thems braves!  'MURRICA!"

There was a congressional hearing a while back in congress on NASA's budget and the representative was asked "if there was a meteor heading towards earth what could we do?" and the person from nasa responded, "pray" and congress went, "We'll see what we can do about your budget". . . . but have they increased the budget at all?
